BRIDGE: A construction or natural feature that spans a divide.
CASTLE: A large building that is fortified and contains many defences; in previous ages often inhabited by a nobleman or king.
FORT: A ____ified defensive structure stationed with troops.
MONUMENT: A structure built for commemorative or symbolic reasons, or as a memorial; a commemoration.
PALACE: Official residence of a head of state or other dignitary, especially in a monarchical or imperial governmental system.
TOWER: A very tall iron-framed structure, usually painted red and white, on which microwave, radio, satellite, or other communication antennas are installed; mast.
